title: Gold pulls back as stocks rise and ECB maintains stimulus plan
text:
Gold prices slipped on Thursday as global stocks traded higher on better-than-expected quarterly results in the final policy update from ECB President Mario Draghi.

December gold GCZ19, +0.41% on Comex slipped $2.30, or 0.2%, at $1,493.40 an ounce, after posting a 0.6% gain.

Silver for December deliver SIZ19, +1.14%, meanwhile, shed 2 cents, or 0.1%, to reach $17.5 an ounce, following a gain of 0.5% on Wednesday.

In the final meeting with Draghi at the helm, the European Central Bank left its main deposit facility rate at negative 0.5% and its main lending rate at 0%. The rate-setting Governing Council repeated that it expects to keep rates at “present or lower levels” until inflation, which has remained stubbornly low, “robustly” converges with its target of near but just below 2%. It also reiterated that it will begin a controversial bond-buying program at a pace of 20 billion euros a month beginning in November.

The central bank will hold its news conference at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time.

Draghi’s swan song comes ahead of the Federal Reserve’s Oct. 29-30 policy meeting, which is expected to result in a 25 basis-point cut to benchmark rates — a decision that could add a boost to gold prices.

Prices of metals thus far in the session have been subdued.

“The gold price escaped from Draghi’s fanfare and the price action was pretty quiet,” wrote Naeem Aslam, chief markets analysts at Think Markets U.K., in a Thursday research note.

“Having said this, we may see the volatility pick up later on when Draghi speaks,” he speculated.

Meanwhile, global stock benchmarks were rising, with those for the Dow Jones Industrial DJIA, -0.20% nd the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.02% set to climb at Thursday’s open, signaling that appetite for so-called havens like gold may be low.

In other metals trade, January platinum PLF20, +1.18% gained $2.90, or 0.3%, at $925.30 an ounce, adding to its 3% gain on Wednesday, while December palladium PAZ19, +1.30% jumped 1.1% to $1,732.30 an ounce, following its own gain a day ago.

December copper HGZ19, -0.24% climbed 0.1% at $2.674 a pound.
description: Gold prices slip Thursday as global stocks trade higher in the final policy update from ECB President Mario Draghi.
